intro: Ebracteola wilmaniae, commonly known as the Wilman's ebracteola, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmate, with three to five lobes, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
